}}'''Gilean Alistair Tristram McVean''' is a professor of statistical [[genetics]] at the [[University of Oxford]]<ref>http://www.stats.ox.ac.uk/~mcvean/ McVean Group at the University of Oxford</ref> and a fellow of [[Linacre College, Oxford]]. He is a member of the [[1000 Genomes Project]] steering committee.<ref name=epmc>{{EuropePMC|ORCID=0000-0002-5012-4162}}</ref>

==Education==
McVean completed his PhD in the Department of Genetics, at the [[University of Cambridge]] with [[Laurence Hurst]]<ref>{{Cite journal 
| last1 = McVean | first1 = G.T. 
| last2 = Hurst | first2 = L.D. 
| doi = 10.1038/386388a0 
| title = Evidence for a selectively favourable reduction in the mutation rate of the X chromosome 
| journal = Nature 
| volume = 386 
| issue = 6623 
| pages = 388–392 
| year = 1997 
| pmid = 9121553 
| pmc = 
}}</ref><ref>{{Cite journal 
| last1 = Hurst | first1 = L.D. 
| last2 = McVean | first2 = G.T. 
| doi = 10.1038/381650a0 
| title = ... And scandalous symbionts 
| journal = Nature 
| volume = 381 
| issue = 6584 
| pages = 650–651 
| year = 1996 
| pmid = 8649507 
| pmc = 
}}</ref> in 1997.<ref name="biography">http://www.stats.ox.ac.uk/people/academic_staff/gilean_mcvean Gilean McVean Oxford University</ref> 

==Career and research==
Following his PhD, McVean completed [[postdoctoral research]] at the [[University of Edinburgh]] under the supervision of [[Brian Charlesworth]] and [[Deborah Charlesworth]].<ref>{{Cite journal 
| last1 = Charlesworth | first1 = D. 
| last2 = Charlesworth | first2 = B. 
| last3 = McVean | first3 = G. 
| title = Genome sequences and evolutionary biology, a two-way interaction 
| journal = Trends in ecology & evolution 
| volume = 16 
| issue = 5 
| pages = 235–242 
| year = 2001 
| pmid = 11301152
 | doi=10.1016/S0169-5347(01)02126-7
}}</ref> From 2000-2004 he was a [[Royal Society]] University Research Fellow, in the Department of Statistics at Oxford, where he has also been a University lecturer in Mathematical Genetics since 2004.

His research<ref>http://scholar.google.com/scholar?q=gilean+mcvean Gilean McVean in [[Google Scholar]]</ref> focuses on [[population genetics]], statistics<ref>{{Cite journal
